event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_FAKE_STORE
event.text: A Slug transport ship is stationed near the beacon with a military escort ship. They message you, "We have been waiting for a customer for agesss. Care to see our waresss?"
"Oh well... We ssshall wait here then." You cautiously put distance between your ships before preparing to jump.
"Before we get ahead of ourssselves, I need to explain sssome ground ruless of our transsaction. Thesse are dangerous times, yess?"
"Firssst... We accept no tradesss, couponss or refundss. Purchasess are final. Underssstand?"
"We hold no liability for productsss damaged post ssale. We offer no insurance or customer sservice. Not a problem?"
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."

"During our discussion, my man hass taken the liberty of disabling your weaponss to prevent any complications while completing our... transssaction..." You suddenly register multiple weapon locks, but your own weapons are not responding. Get out of there!
"Thank you. If you could do me one more courtesssy... please die quietly." You suddenly hear gunshots aboard the ship. He must have been stalling for time while they boarded your ship!
"Very well... Impatient alienss..." You prepare to jump.

You prepare to leave but notice noises in your ship. It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while they hacked into your systems. You barely have time to order a red alert before a military ship flies through the clouds intent on your destruction!
"Fine... Not everyone appreciates good dealss..."

choice.text: (Slug crewmember) Our Slug senses someone aboard the ship. Investigate it.

event.text: It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while someone teleported on board. You catch him before he could finish and he teleports away. You immediately prepare for battle.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HULLFIX
event.text: You arrive to find a small Slug repair station. "Greetingsss traveller! Care for a fix up? We could eassily patch up ssome of that damage."
"Too bad! Trussst iss a rare commodity these days." You prepare to jump.
You pull up to the automatic station and after a short time they repair 10 hull damage. You begin to offer your thanks but discover that you can't detach from the station.
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Perhaps some fuel would be an appropriate compensssation?"

choice.text: Give them the 15 fuel they demand.

event.text: You transfer the fuel and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.
"I'm ssssorry to hear that." He presses a button and an explosion rocks the ship. They must have planted a bomb while 'repairing'! Prepare for a fight!
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Now for payment. To enssssure your cooperation we've taken the liberty of installing a limiter on your weapons system."

choice.text: Give them the 50 scrap they demand.

event.text: You transfer the scrap and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.

You activate your thrusters and force your way away from the station. A ship quickly moves in to engage. You'll need to get out of here fast; there may not be time to get the weapons fully operational!
You dock with the station hoping for a quick turnaround, but the automatic machines take their sweet time. When the process finally finishes, you notice only one damage has been repaired.

As you dock with the station your readings go haywire. An EMP blast resonates throughout the ship and your engines shut down. You're a sitting duck as a ship reveals itself and silently moves in to attack!

choice.text: Ask if they would like payment.

event.text: "Ahhh. A fellow businessman. We offer to fix 10 damage for 50 ssscrap."
You perform the transaction and watch carefully as their machines patch the hull. However, everything seems fine. Once they're complete you get ready to jump.
"Too bad. Farewell, traveller." Their mobile station slips into the clouds.
Just before the transmission is cut you hear, "They're not falling for it. Just kill the crew and we can ssstrip..." Looks like you're not getting out of here without a fight.

event.name: SLUG_DRINK
event.text: A Slug captain hails and invites himself aboard your ship to present a flask of something slimy. "Now, most gracioussss captain, you must join me please in a drink to our alliance!"

You take a cautious gulp. It's foul, but doesn't do any lasting damage. It's a thousand to one chance, but this Slug actually seems to be trustworthy. He casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.
You take one gulp and wake up with the rest of the crew in the cargo hold... which contains noticeably less scrap than before.
The Slug feigns offense at your refusal, but you sense that he respects your caution. This does not, however, prevent him from returning to his ship and opening fire.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Have your Rockman pose as captain.

event.text: Even if there was something malicious in the drink, you doubt it would affect the Rock digestive system. The Slug casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.

Your crewmember is able to identify a heavy anaesthetic contained in the flask when he feels slightly drowsy (the Rock digestion system is very robust). His ruse discovered, the Slug immediately returns to his ship and opens fire.

event.name: SLUG_TRADER_LASER
event.text: A friendly Slug trader greets you at the beacon. "Congratulationsss! You are the winner! You are our 95th customer today! All of our productsss have 95% discount! Just for you!" The Slug offers a selection of laser weapons.

escape.text: The Slug trader try to jump away. They charge the FTL drive.

choice.text: Buy a Burst Laser Mark I.

event.text: You do not have any extra scrap so decide to settle for the cheapest of laser weapons.
The Slugs complete the transaction. "Thanksss. It was great to do businessss with you. Please tell all your friends about our store."

choice.text: Buy a Burst Laser Mark II.

event.text: Given the choice, Burst Laser II seems like the most efficient option.
The Slugs complete the transaction. "Thanksss. It was great to do businessss with you. Please tell all your friends about our store."

choice.text: Ask for a Chain Laser Vulcan.

event.text: Guns follow simple logic. The bigger, the better. You ask for Vulcan, looking forward to using that monster against the Rebels.
The Slugs complete the transaction. "Thanksss. It was great to do businessss with you. Please tell all your friends about our store."

event.name: SLUG_TRADER_LASER_SUBSTITUTION_BASIC
event.text: "We apologize but we do not have this particular model available. We have provided you with a sssubstitution. Please remember that we do not accept refunds for disscounted productsss." The Slugs have robbed you again!

choice.text: Give me back my scrap! Attack!
Leave. No refunds is an acceptable policy.

event.name: SLUG_TRADER_LASER_SUBSTITUTION_BURST
event.text: "We apologize but we do not have this particular model available. We have provided you with a sssubstitution. Please remember that we do not accept refunds for disscounted productsss." The Slugs have robbed you again!

choice.text: Give me back my scrap! Attack!
Leave. No refunds is an acceptable policy.

changelog.entry: Added Slug upgrading oxygen system event

event.name: SLUG_UPGRADE_OXYGEN
event.text: There is nothing interesting at the beacon, with exception of nebula clouds and a lonely Slug ship hiding within them.
The captain of the Slug ship contacts you. "Greetingssss, aliensss. We Slugsss are the greatest engineersss in the galaxy! Allow us to prove it by upgrading your ship. For a modest price."
Workers arrive from the Slug ship and quickly install a life support system.
The Slugs clearly do not want to fight. They try to escape.
The captain of the Slug ship contacts you. "Greetingssss, aliensss. We Slugsss are the greatest engineersss in the galaxy! Allow us to prove it by upgrading your ship. For a modest price."
Workers arrive from the Slug ship and quickly install necessary upgrades to your life support system.
The Slugs clearly do not want to fight. They try to escape.
The captain of the Slug ship contacts you. "Greetingssss, aliensss. We Slugsss are the greatest engineersss in the galaxy! Allow us to prove it by upgrading your ship. For a modest price."
Workers arrive from the Slug ship and quickly install necessary upgrades to your life support system.
The Slugs clearly do not want to fight. They try to escape.
The Slug ship scans you and silently moves away. You charge FTL drive and prepare to jump.
The Slugs have done an excellent job. Maybe they really are the best engineers after all.

The Slugs have done an excellent job and jumped away. After they are gone, you find out that most of your resources from hold and hidden compartments have disappeared. Maybe the Slugs are good engineers, but they can never be trusted.

The Slugs have outdone themselves. Your life support system pumps out oxygen at alarming speed. They have failed to install limiting measures and soon oxygen explodes, turning your ship into burning inferno. The Slugs attack, it all was a part of their plan.
The Slugs have done an excellent job. But they took remote control over your life support system with them. As soon as they leave, they charge the weapons. Their intentions are clear.

destroyed.text: The Slug ship breaks apart and your systems return to normal. You collect what you can.

deadCrew.text: With their crew dead, your systems return to normal. You strip the ship.

event.name: SLUG_SLAVER_EXTORTION
event.text: You encounter a Slug ship of impressive size. Slug captain appears on screen. "Welcome, dear friend! I know who you are and where you are going. With a presssss of this button I can inform everyone in the galaxy. Let's make a deal: sssend me a laborer and I will keep your location sssecret."

escape.text: The Slug captain laughs. "Ssssee you later!" He charges the FTL drive.

choice.text: Accept to send a crewmember into slavery.

event.text: The chosen crewmember leaves the ship to meet his new master. Slug captain laughs in your face. "Thanksss. Don't worry, I will find a honessst job for them."

removeCrew.text: You briefly consider cloning a replacement, but decide to respect the Federation laws regarding simultaneous duplicates.

event.text: The Slug captain calms down and pings you again. "I never expected you would actually agree to thisss deal. Might as well pay you sssome scrap."
The Slug captain presses a big red button and sends information about your precise location to Rebels.
"Not going for that, huh?" Turns out the Slug captain was bluffing.

changelog.entry: Added Zoltan trader in Slug sector event

event.name: SLUG_ZOLTAN_TRADER
event.text: It is unusual to see a Zoltan ship deep inside Slug territory. "Greetings! Would you like to purchase some resources? I have heard about your mission and I am sure that this ammunition will help you bring peace to the galaxy."

destroyed.text: The Zoltan ship breaks apart. You collect what you can. After hours of work your crew manages to restore functionality of all systems.

deadCrew.text: With all the Slugs dead, you strip the ship. Your crew manages to restore functionality of all systems.

event.text: You ask for fuel and send some scrap in exchange.
After the trade is complete you prepare to leave the system. Zoltans wish you luck: "Slugs in this sector do all kinds of dirty tricks. Make sure to upgrade your oxygen system."

You did not understand what exactly happened but after you loaded the fuel, your engines stopped working. The Zoltan ship prepares to attack you. It turns out that the ship is controlled by Slugs. Get ready for battle!
You ask for missiles and send some scrap in exchange.
After the trade is complete you prepare to leave the system. Zoltans wish you luck: "Slugs in this sector do all kinds of dirty tricks. Make sure to upgrade your oxygen system."

After the missiles are loaded you are immediately contacted by your engineer. "Weapon system is out of order, sir!" The Zoltan ship prepares to attack you. It turns out that the ship is controlled by Slugs. It will be difficult to defend yourself without any weapons.
You ask for the special offer and send some scrap in exchange.
After the trade is complete you prepare to leave the system. Zoltans wish you luck: "Slugs in this sector do all kinds of dirty tricks. Make sure to upgrade your oxygen system."

You install the augmentation. One after another shield layers that protected your ship dissipate. The Zoltan ship prepares to attack you. It turns out that the ship is controlled by Slugs. With shields offline, it is going to be a tough battle.

choice.text: (Slug) Your crewmember advises against the deal.

event.text: Your crewmember detects that the Zoltan ship is actually controlled by Slugs! They were going to trick you and capture your ship. As soon as you blew their cover, they arm the weapons.
After you scan the ship, you detect that it is actually controlled by Slugs! They were going to trick you and capture your ship. As soon as you blew their cover, they arm the weapons.

event.name: SLUG_DISTRESS_TRICK
event.text: You find a Slug vessel broadcasting the distress signal and contact them. "Ah, yesss, we are having problems with our oxygen generation unit. Perhaps your crew can assist in repairsss?"

As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. Despite being outnumbered, your crew is able to break free of the Slug trap and fight back to the airlock. You pull away from the enemy ship but not before a few Slugs make it on board.
As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. On your way back to the airlock, one of your crewmembers is taken out by a well aimed Slug blaster shot.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was immediately revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: You cautiously board their ship and immediately smell the stale air of a malfunctioning life support. In no time at all you're able to fix up the problem and head off again with some extra scrap in your hold.
You know better than to trust the Slugs. You cut communications and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Have your Mantis oversee the repairs.

event.text: Once on board, it becomes clear that nothing is wrong with their O2 system. Almost expecting this, your Mantis calmly responds to the trap. Once a couple of the Slugs have been spread across the walls of their ship, the rest surrender.
